questions.question_text: A technician is hardening a company file server and needs to prevent unauthorized LAN devices from accessing stored files. Which of the following should the technician use?

discussion.content:
A. Software firewall
A software firewall is the most appropriate solution to prevent unauthorized LAN devices from accessing the file server. By configuring firewall rules to restrict access to specific IP addresses or ports, the technician can effectively control who can access the server's resources.

Selected Answer: A
A.

Use a (software) firewall to manage allowed connections on the file server.

B. CPU
E. RAM
The Hardware Compatibility List (HCL) specifies the hardware and software configurations that are supported by a particular software application. If the workstation's CPU or RAM does not meet the HCL requirements, the software installation will fail.

Selected Answer: BE
CPU and RAM are very common system requirements to run software. None of the rest make any sense at all.

Selected Answer: BE
Whoever voted anything else than B and E, back to studying!!!

Selected Answer: BE
looking this question up on other sites its BE

Selected Answer: BE
If you ever installed anything, first requirement is Storage. Then CPU. Then RAM then maybe GPU if its a video game

Selected Answer: AB
Shouldn't it be CPU and NIC?

Selected Answer: AE
chatgpt
NIC (Network Interface Card - Option A): The NIC is crucial for network-related operations. If the NIC is not compatible with the software or lacks the necessary drivers, it could result in installation failure, especially if the software requires network connectivity or communication during the installation process.

RAM (Random Access Memory - Option E): Incompatibility with RAM can also lead to installation failures. The software may have specific requirements regarding the amount or type of RAM needed for proper installation and operation.

The other options are less likely to be directly related to installation failure:

CPU (Central Processing Unit - Option B): While certain software may have specific CPU requirements, it's less common for installation failures to be directly attributed to CPU incompatibility.

comments.content:
I got this answer from ChatGPT: The two components most likely causing the installation to fail due to incompliance with the HCL (Hardware Compatibility List) are:

B. CPU
E. RAM

The CPU and RAM are critical components when it comes to ensuring that software is compatible with the system. If the CPU or RAM does not meet the minimum requirements or is not listed on the HCL, the software may fail to install or run properly.

Other options:

A. NIC – A network interface card might be needed for certain installations, but it is less likely to cause an installation failure due to HCL incompliance.
C. PSU – The power supply unit typically wouldn't directly affect software installation unless there is a power failure.
D. KVM – A keyboard, video, and mouse switch has no impact on software installation.
F. DVI – DVI (Digital Visual Interface) is a display connector and not directly related to software installation.
But ChatGPT can never be wrong!
When was the last time your software disagreed to run because you were using ethernet and not wifi?

questions.question_text: A technician is installing software on a user’s workstation. The installation fails due to incompliance with the HCL. Which of the following components is most likely causing the installation to fail? (Choose two.)
Which of the following items require special e-waste recycling? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A. Solid-state drive
E. CRT monitor
Solid-state drives and CRT monitors contain hazardous materials that require special recycling processes to prevent environmental damage. These items should be disposed of properly through designated e-waste recycling programs.

comments.content: Always double-check AI systems. Laptop Battery is the obvious second correct answer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
They have to be disposed of because of environmental concerns. DE

questions.question_text: A user reports that the hard drive activity light on a Windows 10 desktop computer has been steadily lit for more than an hour and performance is severely degraded. Which of the following tabs in Task Manager contains the information a technician should use to identify the cause of this issue?

discussion.content:
B. Processes
The Processes tab in Task Manager provides detailed information about the running processes on the system, including their CPU and disk usage. By identifying the process that is causing high disk usage, the technician can determine the root cause of the issue.

comments.content: Task Manager > Processes > Disk > Resource Monitor *

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Task Manager > Disk > Resource Monitor

Selected Answer: B
B.

Check the processes tab within task manager to find out what is taking up HDD utilization.

Selected Answer: A
The only one that makes any sense at all is A.

Selected Answer: A
None of the other answers make sense to me. CDs typically have less storage than USB drives and aren't in use much these days.

Selected Answer: A
Sometimes if the file is big cannot be called via the network. Therefore, having it in a removable media and copy it directly to a machine is a successful solution.

comments.content: Let me know when you find a tablet in which you can insert a CD dude. USB is possible since there are USB C flash drives.
No way - what tablets have a CD drive? None of the answers are great - but USB is the least bad.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I "think" it's B....

A - If the technician received a copy error, then why would we assume attempting to copy to a USB drive will work?

C - Doesn't make sense

D - Doesn't make sense

choices.C: Format the HDD and then do the installation.
choices.A: Copy the program file to a USB drive and install.
choices.D: Replace the HDD and then do the installation
choices.B: Burn the program file to a CD and install.

Which of the following is the best procedure for the technician to use to complete the assignment?
